title: Ticket Dashboard
custom_preconds: Given users are on the ticket dashboard

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navigates to the Ticket Dashboard for a team that has digital access enabled
And the user has not yet linked their account
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the cell directly below the sub nav will display a message directing the users to link their account
And there will be a 'Link Account' button
And tapping that button will bring the user to the Ticketing Accounts page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navigates to the Ticket Dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see a button for the Team Picker on the top left
And a POI indicator (when applicable) on the top right
And the sub nav below that
And the current/next event module below that
And buttons to buy, upgrade(if applicable) for current/next
And a timestamp showing last update time (with a tappable button to update)
And a section with upcoming events (next 3 home)
And a button for all home events 
And a section that displays event "cards" with for any event for which the user has tickets
And a transfers section with received and sent
And a section for supplemental ticketing webviews
And a button to take the user to Settings > Ticketing Accounts (filtered for club)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the event information
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the team names and logos (Nationals @ Cardinals), the event date/time (stadium time zone) & stadium name

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the button available for the Next/Current Event
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see Buy Tickets and Upgrade buttons (but NOT Upgrade if the "upgradeURL:" is blank for that ballpark in the ballpark.json)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a ticket in the tickets found section (if user has tickets for current/next event)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the Scan View for that specific ticket

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks to the left of their seat information in the Tickets Found section (if they have tickets for the current/next event)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then they will see a ticket image for each ticket in their inventory

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Buy Tickets button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the native ticket flow for that game

custom_steps_separated.content:
When native ticket enabled is false for a team
and the user taps on the Buy Tickets button either from the ticket dashboard game module or the ticket event detail view
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will be taken through the mobile ticket purchase flow

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Upgrades button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the upgrading ticket webview

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on card of one of their "YOUR UPCOMING EVENTS"
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the Full Ticket List view for the next/upcoming event

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a game cell in the Next Home Events section and they do NOT have tickets for that event
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be taken into the native ticket flow or web ticket flow if NTP is not enabled

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a game cell in the Next Home Events section and they DO have tickets for that event
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the Ticket List view for that specific game
and will see the following:
- a carrot back button on the top left
- a Forward mode button in the top right
- a cell with team names and logos (Nationals @ Cardinals)
- event date & stadium name
- game start time in stadium local time and timezone
- a section for buying, upgrading(if applicable) buttons

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on All Home Events button below the upcoming events section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the Home Events master list
And it will display the following
- a carrot back button on the top left
- a refresh timestamp
- list of all future home events
(each cell will display the following:
- logo of the team they are playing against
- day of, and the date of the game
- the team they are playing against, and start time with timezone)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on an event cell in the Home Events master list they DO have tickets to
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the Ticket List view for that event

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on an event cell in the Home Events master list they do NOT have tickets to
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be taken into the native ticket flow or web ticket flow if NTP is not enabled

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on an event card in the future ticketed games section (Your Upcoming Events)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the Ticket List view for the selected event
And the user will see the number of tickets found in the refresh timestamp section
And the user will see a list of all the tickets found
And the user will see a section for buying, upgrading(if applicable) buttons

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the All Ticketed Games button (e.g. See All in Your Upcoming Events section)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
**Not applicable for 6.x**

Then the user will be taken to the All Ticketed Games view
And it will display the following:
- a carrot back button on the top left
- a refreshed timestamp
- list of tickets with the number of tickets found for that specific event

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Received or Sent button under the ticket forwards section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the ticket forward page
And it will display the following:
- a carrot back button on the top left
- a received and sent indicator(one of these cells will be highlighted based on the one tapped to navigate to this page)
- a list of all completed transactions
- a list of all cancelled transactions
(each transaction will display the following:
- day of event and opponent for game event/title for non game event
- section, row, and seat)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a completed transaction on the received section of the ticket forward page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the Forward details page
And the page will display the following:
- a carrot back button on the top left
- event information
- ticket information
- forward details (From, Date, Status)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a completed transaction on the sent section of the ticket forward page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the Forward details page
And the page will display the following:
- a carrot back button on the top left
- event information
- a cancel forward button
- ticket information
- forward details (To, Date, Accepted By, Status)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the cancel forward button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the ticket that was forwarded will be returned to the current user

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks to the left of the event information on the cells in the Upcoming Events section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the opponents team logo or generic icon for non game event

(please confirm for all 30 teams)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the cards for upcoming events for which they have tickets "Your Upcoming Events"
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the opponents team logo or generic icon for non game event in the background

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the Ticket Dashboard
And sees a time
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the time will be displayed as local time of the selected ballpark with time zone

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has a ticket(s) for the current day
AND the user looks at the Tickets dashboard of that team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will the ticket(s) listed in the Tickets Dashboard

*Changing device date to the date of the ticket will not work as of 6.2, will need tickets for an event on today's server date

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has a ticket(s) for the current day and swipes left on one of the rows
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be able to access a quick link to the forward or cancel forward ticket functionality depending if the ticket is currently in their inventory or in a pending state

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has a PARKING ticket for the current day
AND the user looks at the ticket dashboard for that team that the parking ticket is for
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Parking ticket will display first in the list followed by the game tickets

title: Ticket List Views
custom_preconds:

The swipe to forward/cancel button is only in iOS 8 and up

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a Show More link below the ticket rows

custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the link will become Show Less

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the scan view

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on an event cell in the Upcoming Events section

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on an event cell in the Upcoming Events section

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on an event cell in the Your Upcoming Events section

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the All Ticketed Games button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
**not for 6.x**

Then the user will be taken to the All Ticketed Events List
And the user will see a button to return back to the dashboard at the top left
And below that the ticket count with a timestamp & refresh control
And below that will be a list of all ticketed events for the user

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on an event cell in the All Ticketed Events List
custom_steps_separated.expected:
**not for 6.x**

Then the user will be taken to the Event Full Ticket List

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is in the event ticket list view
and the user has a ticket that has not been forwarded
and the user swipes that ticket cell to the left
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will see a blue 'Forward' button appear

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is in the tickets list view
and the user has not forwarded a ticket
and the user swipes that ticket to the left to display the forward button
and the user taps on the forward button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the forward options will display from the bottom
and the user can tap on one of those options to forward the ticket

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has a ticket in pending forward status in the tickets list view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the ticket in the list view will display the forward arrow icon
and when the user now swipes to the left on that ticket it will have a cancel button

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is in the tickets list view
and the user has a ticket that has been forwarded
and the user swipes that ticket to the left
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will see a red 'Cancel' button

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is in the tickets list view
and the user has a ticket that has been forwarded
and the user swipes that ticket to the left
and the user taps on the 'Cancel' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user get a cancel confirmation prompt

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user cancels a ticket forward via the swipe action in the tickets list view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the forward arrow icon will be removed from that ticket 
and then blue forward button will now appear when the user swipes it to the left

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has a PARKING ticket in addition to tickets for a game
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the PARKING ticket will always display first in the list followed by the game tickets

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has a ticket in the tickets list view that has been scanned(check mark indicator)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will not be able to swipe that scanned ticket to forward/cancel

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has an unpaid ticket in their tickets list view
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will not be able to t swipe that unpaid ticket to forward/cancel

custom_steps_separated.content: When user has a non-forwardable ticket(ex. unpaid ticket)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the non-forwardable ticket will have a red indicator appear next to it
AND the user will not be able to swipe to forward that ticket

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user interacts with the current event ticket list on the Ticket Dashboard (looks at icons, tries to forward or cancel via swipe)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the current event ticket list should look and behave like the full Ticket List view behavior from the previous steps

title: Ticket Indicators
custom_preconds:
Blue Dot = New Ticket
Red X = Non-forwardable ticket(Usually unpaid tickets)
Check Mark = Scanned Ticket
Arrow = Pending Transfer State

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the Ticket Dashboard in the Tickets Found section
And the user has new tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the tickets will have a blue dot next to them in the list
And when the user returns to this page the green dot will dismiss

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the Event Full Ticket List
And the user has new tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the tickets will have a blue dot next to them in the list
And when the user returns to this page the blue dot will dismiss

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the Ticket Dashboard in the Tickets Found section
And the user has tickets that have already been scanned
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the tickets will have a check mark next to them in the list

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the Event Full Ticket List
And the user has tickets that have already been scanned
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the tickets will have a check mark next to them in the list

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the Ticket Dashboard in the Tickets Found section
And the user has tickets that are in a Pending Transfer State
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the tickets will have an arrow next to them in the list

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the Event Full Ticket List
And the user has tickets that are in a Pending Transfer State
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the tickets will have an arrow next to them in the list

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the event full ticket list
and the user has tickets that are non-forwardable
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the tickets will have a red X next to them in the list

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has a new ticket which is also a non-forwardable ticket
and the user looks at the ticket for the first time in the list view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see first see a blue dot next to that ticket
and then after viewing it the blue dot will change to a red X

title: Add to Wallet(aka Passbook)
custom_preconds:
Wallet is available on phone
prod account setup with a prod credit card
need to purchase a real ticket from prod
*see Marco for prod credit card
custom_steps:
1. Purchase a ticket for SF Giants(any tdc would work but using SF as an example)
2. After purchasing ticket go to the 'My SF tix' webview found on the tickets dashboard
3. On the webview tap on 'View Ticket Inventory'
4. Open the ticket you purchased
5. Tap on the Add to passbook button
custom_expected: When you view your Wallet(aka Passbook) you should now see the ticket you added from the My SF Tix webview

title: Scan View
custom_preconds:
The user can access the scan view from the ticket dashboard or from the ticketed event list

For additional information about the scan view animations: BP-4750
For more details on the general scan view design: BP-5279

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a ticket item from the Ticket Dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the Scan View for that ticket

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a ticket item from the ticketed event list
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the Scan View for that ticket

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the Scan View
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the correct team logo
And an 'X' button to close the view
And their account name
And their account number 
And a bar/QRC code
And the event information (time local to stadium)
And the standard SEC ROW SEAT
And space for an ad
And a bottom bar with controls

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the Scan View
And the user has > 1 ticket
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be able to swipe to navigate their tickets

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the Scan View
And the user taps the Forward Tickets button on the bottom
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be presented with an option to Forward Ticket, Forward Ticket Via Link, or Cancel

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the Scan View
And the user taps on the Show Ticket Back button (i)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the Ticket Back View

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the Scan View and has fewer than 15 tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a series of dots that highlight their progress through their tickets (e.g. 5 dots with the second dot filled in when the user is displaying the second ticket in a set of 5)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the Scan View and has greater than 15 tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a numeric display of which ticket is displayed out of the set (e.g. 12 of 15, when showing the 12th ticket in a set of 15 for that event)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Ad
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the sponsor webview / external site

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on a device with a smaller screen
And the user scrolls
custom_steps_separated.expected: The bottom bar will stay locked in place

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the 'X' button in the top right
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought back to their entry point

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the Scan View
And the user receives an app controlled notification (poi notification, auto check in)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the app will suppress those notications

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user enters the Scan View
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the app will set the device to maximum brightness
And dismissing the Scan View will return the device's brightness to where it was prior
Then the app will not show a barcode and there will be an error message displayed provided by the ticket data

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user enters the scan view of ticket that has been scanned
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will see a message in the bottom where the forward button is normally located - "SCANNED"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user opens the scan view of an unpaid ticket or non forwardable ticket, in the data it will appear like this:
"forwardable": false,
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will not see a forward button at the bottom of the scan view

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user opens the scan view of a scanned ticket
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will not see a forward button at the bottom of the scan view

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has opened the scan view of a ticket
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the scan view will have an animation of a dot going from left to right

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has opened the scan view of a ticket and CMS has configured an animation, it look like this in the data: 
"backgroundVid": "https://bp-cms.mlb.com/digital_ticketing/animated_assets/ari_backgroundVid.mp4",
"backgroundVidPoster": "https://bp-cms.mlb.com/digital_ticketing/poster/ari_backgroundVidPoster.jpg",
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then an animation will play in the scan view background area

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has the scan view opened
and the user backgrounds the app
and the user foregrounds the app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the animation will still be active in the scan view

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has the scan view opened
and the user fast switches to another app
then the user fast switches back to Ballark
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the animation will still be active in the scan view

title: Ticket Forwarding
custom_preconds:
Given the user has tickets
And he/she wants to give them away

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the scan view
And taps on the Forward button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought to a ticket list view for that event for multiple ticket selection (see multi ticket forward test cases for more)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has a Ticket Forward in progress
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Forwards history module will become visible on the Ticket Dashboard (Ticket Forwards header, Received / Sent tappable rows)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has a ticket forward in progress
And the user decides to cancel the forwarding
(confirm cancelling from scan view, swipe on ticket row of list view and forward history)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be displayed a loading screen that indicates the cancellation of the ticket transaction
And the following will happen:
- if the ticket was forwarded via link, then the webpage will inform the user the invitation is no longer valid
- if the ticket was forwarded via email, then tapping the link in the email will alert the user the forward is no longer valid

custom_steps_separated.content: When no Forwards (EVER) are found for the user's history
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the app will hide the Forward history module from the Ticket Dashboard

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user forwards a ticket via link or email
And the receiver accepts the ticket
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the receiver will have the ticket in their account

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user forwards a ticket via link or email
And the transaction is completed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the receiver will have the tickets show up on the ticket dashboard for that specific team
And the receiver will have the ticket icon appear over the ticket dashboard nav
And the reveiver will have the ticket icon appear in the team picker page for that ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user forwards all tickets from one ballpark
And the transaction is completed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the sender should no longer have the tickets
And the sender should have all tickets appear under the ticket forward "sent" page
And the sender should not see the ticket icon on the ticket dashboard nav
And the sender should not see the ticket icon on the team picker page for that ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has completed a Forward in the past
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Forwards module will become visible on the Ticket Dashboard

custom_steps_separated.content: When Box Office disables ticket forward on a per ticket basis (need dev help)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Forward button will be hidden on the Scan View for that ticket

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a ticket is forwarded
And the other user received it and completed the transaction
And the sender cancels the forward from the ticket forwards history page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the sender will receive the ticket back regardless of the transaction being completed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the Forward Module is visible on the Ticket Dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be able to access a list of their forwarding activity history

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a PARKING ticket is forwarded
AND the other user received it and completed the transaction
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the parking ticket will display first in the tickets list for that particular game that the ticket is for

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on the tickets list view
and the user has tickets that can be forwarded
and the user swipes to forward a ticket
and the user taps on 'Forward' blue button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Forward Ticket, Forward via Link, and Cancel buttons will appear from bottom

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user swipes to forward a ticket
and the user taps on the Forward Ticket button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the forward ticket email form
*Complete full forward(send and receive)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user swipes to forward a ticket
and the user taps on Forward via Link
and the user chooses an app to forward with
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be brought to that app
AND the user will be shown the forward link for the ticket
*Complete full forward(Send and receive)

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has a non-forwardable ticket in the list view
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN that ticket will have a red X next to it.

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has a non-forwardable ticket in the list view
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will not be able to forward that ticket (no check box in multi forward mode and cannot be swiped to reveal Forward button)

title: Multi-Ticket Forwarding
custom_preconds:
Given the user has multiple tickets
And he/she wants to give them away simultaneously

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user goes to the tickets list view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a 'Forward' button on the top right

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user goes to the tickets list view
and taps on the 'Forward' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see check circles appearing next to their ticket(s)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is in the tickets list view
and the user taps on the 'Forward' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be able to select a ticket or multiple tickets
and a check mark will appear next to each ticket that is selected

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on the tickets list view
and taps on the 'Forward' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a 'Forward' button will appear at the bottom of the page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is in the tickets list view
and the user has a ticket that has already been forwarded
and the user taps on the 'Forward' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the check circle will not appear on the previously forwarded ticket
and no action will occur if the user taps on that ticket's cell

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user in the tickets list view
and the user has a ticket that is unpaid(non-forwardable)
and the user taps on the 'Forward' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the check circle will not appear next to the unpaid ticket
and no action will occur if the user taps on the ticket's cell

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is in the tickets list view
and the user taps on the 'Forward' button
and the user selects one or more tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see a numerical value displayed at the top of the view
and that value will be the number of tickets that the user has selected

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is in the tickets list view
and the user taps on the 'Forward' button
and the user selects one or more tickets
and the user taps on the 'Forward' button at bottom the page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be taken to the forward ticket email form
and the ticket(s) selected will appear in that form

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a users is on the tickets forward email form
and the user is about to forward multiple tickets
and the user taps on the 'Send' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the tickets will successfully send
and you will get a message stating the tickets have been successfully forwarded

custom_steps_separated.content:
After multiple tickets have been forwarded 
and the user goes back to the tickets list view
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN all the tickets that have been forwarded will have the forward arrow icon next to them

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user decides to cancel one of the tickets that was forwarding during a multi ticket forward
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN after canceling the forward, only that one ticket will be cancelled and the other tickets will still be in a forwarded state

custom_steps_separated.content: When multiple tickets forwarded have been accepted by the receiver
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN when we refresh our tickets list view the tickets that have been forwarded will get removed

custom_steps_separated.content:
When multiple tickets have been forwarded
and we look at the 'Sent' tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN we will see all the tickets that group of tickets which were forwarded under the pending section

custom_steps_separated.content:
When multiple tickets that have been forwarded are accepted by the receiver
and we look under the Sent tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN we will see all the tickets that were accepted by receiver display under the Completed section

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user accepts a multi ticket forward
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN when the user is taken to the app they will get an alert
and the alert will have two options: Dismiss and View Tickets
and tapping on Dismiss will close the alert
and tapping on 'View Tickets' will take the user to the tickets list view for that game

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user accepts a multi ticket forward
and there is an error during the acceptance of the tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN in the app the user will get an alert stating 'Unable to accept x out of x tickets. Please try again or call (phone number) for assistance'
and there will be three buttons: FAQ, 'Try Again', and 'Dismiss'
